message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest serotonin syndrome, which is caused by the combination of medications the patient is taking. Management includes discontinuing the offending medications, in this case tramadol and citalopram. Cyproheptadine and diazepam are also used in the management of serotonin syndrome but discontinuation of the medication is the first step. Selegiline is not indicated in the management of serotonin syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest serotonin syndrome, which can be caused by the combination of citalopram and tramadol. Discontinuing both medications is the first step in management. Cyproheptadine and diazepam may also be used to manage the symptoms, but discontinuing the medications causing the syndrome is the primary step. Selegiline is not indicated in the management of serotonin syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is showing signs of serotonin syndrome, most likely due to the combination of citalopram and tramadol. The first step in management is to discontinue both medications. Cyproheptadine can be used to treat severe cases, but it’s not the first step of management. Diazepam can be used to treat symptoms such as tremors, but it does not address the underlying cause of serotonin syndrome. Selegiline is not indicated for the treatment of serotonin syndrome.

Cyproheptadine and Diazepam can be used for symptomatic relief, but discontinuing the medications is the most important step. Selegiline is not used in the management of serotonin syndrome.
